SlideBody.Heading: Common Pitfalls: C++
SlideBody.BodyText:
In C and C++, as in JavaScript, the key is to validate all inputs. Do not make bad assumptions about your data.
Buffer overruns are a major source of security problems...still.

List.ListItem: Don't make assumptions about the length of the input - pass a length value in your API.
Don't assume that strings (char*) are null-terminated.
Use strncpy() instead of strcpy(), and snprintf() instead of sprintf(). Or better yet,
Use Mozilla string classes (nsString, etc) wherever possible instead of char* strings.
Verify that array subscripts are in range (and non-negative!)
